page.title: 03PHEASANT SHOOTING
page.content: All the pheasant shooting in Durwood is done by Mr Levitch. When they are shot they are taken to be sold. The pheasants are reared in the middle of the wood. They let them grow to a good size and then let them out, beat them out of the trees, shoot the birds, and then sell them. The pheasant shooting season is October 1st to February 1st. There are twenty two Saturdays in the pheasant shooting season. The pheasants are reared by Mr.L.Gould. You have to pay Â£2.50 for each brace of pheasants shot. When the pheasants are shot they are kept in a stone building which can hold about 4000 pheasants. The shooters have to pay for the pheasants' food and also contribute to the Â£9.00 a day paid to the beaters.
